welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: Welcome to ForSURE, your EPR Reporting tool. \n\nTo introduce you to the platform, we‚Äôll start by taking you on a tour across it‚Äôs pages and functions. The onboarding will take about 10 minutes, and afterwards you‚Äôll know what steps to take to generate and submit your EPR reports efficiently.

guide.title: Guide
guide.text: You can navigate through this guide using the Next button or by using the arrow keys on your keyboard to go to the next or previous item.\n\nOn the bottom left you can see which step of the guide you are on. Clicking on the arrow next to it, you can skip to a different section of the guide if you want to revisit something quickly.

help.title: Help
help.text: Should you have any question later on, feel free to revisit this guide at any point by clicking here. This tour will give a general overview of each page and its function, but pressing this button on the other pages will explain the functionalities in depth.

overview.title: Overview
overview.text: This to your Overview page. This space provides an overview of your compliance, offering insights at a glance. There‚Äôs also a table with upcoming EPR deadlines.

categorylist.title: Category List
categorylist.text: Utilize this page to upload and modify your category list. Your category list contains your product information. It serves as the foundation for all reports and charts, so ensuring its accuracy and currency is crucial.

report.title: Create Report
report.text: This area allows you to either create a new report from scratch or upload existing data to be incorporated into your reports. You can also use this page to submit created reports.

history.title: History
history.text: This page houses a comprehensive history of all your reports, enabling you to delve deep into the data for detailed analysis of each report.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.text: This page allows you to create charts from your data. You can choose the data you want to visualize and the way you want to visualize it.

settings.title: Settings
settings.text: On this page, you can configure your ForSURE account. This includes managing the access of the different users and setting country specific settings.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.text: If any error occurs, the error will be shown here. If configured, you can also receive an email with the error message.

overviewReportEnd.title: Overview Report End
overviewReportEnd.text: Now that we‚Äôve shown you all the pages, let‚Äôs dive a little deeper into how to use the functionalities.

map.title: Map
map.text:
This is the compliance map. Here you can see for each country what the status of your compliance is.

Hovering over a country shows you the status for each waste stream. The colors are as following: 
Red: Information missing
Yellow: Audit upcoming or threshold reached
Blue: Report coming up, but handled automatically
Green: Nothing to do

mapIcons.title: Map Icons
mapIcons.text: With the plus icon you can add a new PRO to the map and with the settings icon you can edit the details of the PRO, such as credentials and extra information needed.

deadlineWidget.title: Deadline Widget
deadlineWidget.text: This is the deadline widget. Here you can see the upcoming deadlines for EPR reports once you have selected a country.\n\nIf the deadline field appears in blue, it indicates that our software has already generated the report, which can be found under the History section. If not, the report has yet to be completed.

informationWidget.title: Information Widget
informationWidget.text: This is the information widget. Here you can see important updates and missing information for the different countries. Clicking on the information will show you the details of the information.

informationExpand.title: Information Details Widget
informationExpand.text: Click here to expand the information widget.

informationSettings.title: Information Settings
informationSettings.text: Click here to edit the notification settings, such as your preferred way to receive notifications and which notifications you want to receive.

createChart.title: Create Chart
createChart.text: In the overview page you‚Äôll be able to see various statistics gathered from your data. This can give you concrete overviews related to your waste metrics. There are various ways you can view this using our interactive graph.

selectColumns.title: Select Columns
selectColumns.text: Here you can select any column from your orders or category list that you want to use for the chart. You can search for the columns by typing in the search bar or you can expand the categories to see all the columns.

yAxis.title: Select Y-Axis
yAxis.text: To try it out, start by dragging this element to the Y Axis.

xAxis.title: Select X-Axis
xAxis.text: Next, proceed by dragging this element to the X Axis.

showChart.title: Show Chart
showChart.text: Upon completing these steps, the resulting chart will be displayed.

chartOptions.title: Chart Options
chartOptions.text:
With these icons, you have the ability to: 
- Change the chart type, 
- View the chart in greater detail, and 
- Save the chart for immediate display below.

countryFilter.title: Filters
countryFilter.text: If your focus is on specific countries, you can apply the filter here. Choosing values will automatically refresh all charts to reflect your selections.

dateFilter.title: Filters
dateFilter.text: Similarly, for date filters, such as if you're interested in data from the last month, applying this filter will update all charts to match your specified timeframe.

profileFilter.title: Filters
profileFilter.text: Likewise, you can filter charts based on the source of your data, known as profiles, to tailor the displayed information accordingly.

reportsDue.title: Deadlines
reportsDue.text: This section displays the upcoming deadlines for EPR reports.\nIf the deadline field appears in blue, it indicates that our software has already generated the report, which can be found under the History section. If not, the report has yet to be completed.

example.title: Example
example.text:
Saving a chart will cause it to be displayed here alongside others.
This section offers a quick snapshot of all the metrics you're interested in. 
If you decide a chart is no longer needed, you can easily unpin it to remove it from view. For a deeper dive into a chart's specifics and to understand which orders have contributed to its data, click on the icon located in the top right corner.

Additionally, you have the option to rearrange the order of the charts by dragging the entire chart to a new position.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: Welcome to the report page, please select one of the options, either creating a new report or submitting an existing one.

upload.title: Upload Reports
upload.text: Here you can upload finished reports in different formats to be submitted directly to the corresponding scheme.

clients.title: Clients
clients.text: Here you can configure the client credentials for the different schemes.

uploadFile.title: Upload Reports
uploadFile.text: Drag and drop any report here to submit it to the corresponding authority. The format of the report does not matter as long as it includes some relevant information such as company name, date and the weights to report.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.text: If any error occurs, the error will be shown here. If configured, you can also receive an email with the error message.

create.title: Create New Report
create.text: Click here to create a new report. Here you have the ability to upload data from various sources and generate custom reports at your convenience.

liveData.title: Live Data
liveData.text: If you want to use live data, you can turn on the live data toggle. This will connect to your online stores and use the latest data for the report.

orderListDropZone.title: Order List
orderListDropZone.text: If you want to manually upload orders, you can drag and drop them here. The uploading process can take a few minutes depending on the size of the dataset. Once you have uploaded the orders, you have to map the data to the labels you want to use for the data. You can select different variables in the dropdown, which should correspond with the dataset.

next.title: Next
next.text: In the next step you can add return data to the report. If you have chosen live data, the returns received from it will be used automatically, but you can also upload additional returns manually.\n\nIn the third step, you can select the country, report type and timeframe that you want to create the report for. Finally, you will see an overview of the report details and allow you to create the report you chose. The report will be shown in the history as soon as it is available.

clients.title: Update: Client credentials
clients.text: You can now drag and drop the columns for the client credentials or hide them using the menu in the column header to make editing the passwords easier. The original layout is restored when opening the client credentials again.

upload.title: Update: Create Zero Declaration
upload.text: You can now create a zero declaration report by clicking the button. This will open a popup where you can select the report details. You can then automatically create zero declarations for all companies selected.

welcome.title: Report history
welcome.text: This is the report history page. All reports that were created or that you submitted are shown here as well as the confirmations if they were sent to the corresponding authority.

filters.title: Filters
filters.text: Here you can filter the results shown below by the country, type of report and time. The results are updated immediately.

receipts.title: Additional Filters
receipts.text:
Filter the results to only show the receipt or the new reports. 

You can choose the option Mine to only show the reports that you created yourself.

You can also choose the option New to only show the reports that were created today.

search.title: Search
search.text:
Search for specifics of the report. 

You can search for the company name, country, report type, PRO, timeframe, report name and when it was updated.

You can also try these options: 

25.06: finds all reports that were last updated on the 25th of June

This Week: Finds all reports that were last updated this week.

Other special searches are: today, yesterday, this month, last month

download.title: Download
download.text: To download all reports shown below (applying the filters that you've chosen), click this button. \n\nNote: This might take 1-2mins to get the compressed file ready.

filters.title: Update: New Filter Selection
filters.text: We have improved the filtering such that the results are updated immediately.

receipts.title: Update: Additional Filters
receipts.text: You can now choose the option Mine to only show the reports that you created yourself.\n\nYou can also choose the option New to only show the reports that were created today.

search.title: Update: Improved Search
search.text:
You can now search for more details of the report.

Try these options: 

25.06: finds all reports that were last updated on the 25th of June

This Week: Finds all reports that were last updated this week.

Other special searches are: today, yesterday, this month, last month

status.title: Update: Status Overview
status.text: You can now see the status of the reports in the overview. This will help you to see which reports are still in progress and which are done. You can also click on the status to filter the reports. Clicking a status again will remove the filter.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: Welcome to the download page. All reports that were automatically created or that you created manually are shown here.

inprogress.title: In Progress
inprogress.text: In the first table you find the reports that are in progress. That means that the report deadline has not been reached yet, but we create daily updates to show you how much data you are already reporting until now.

history.title: History
history.text: In this table you find reports that are done and can be evaluated and send to the corresponding scheme

country.title: Sorted by Country
country.text: The reports are grouped by country

debugger.title: Debugger
debugger.text: For each report you have a debugger that contains all raw data that was used in this report. This is especially important for audits.

report.title: Report
report.text: This is the actual report that can be sent to the reporting scheme.

open.title: Open
open.text: The first icon lets you view the report in full screen.

download.title: Download
download.text: The second icon lets you download the EPR report as Excel sheet.

share.title: Share
share.text: The third icon lets you share the report via mail.

delete.title: Delete
delete.text: The fourth icon lets you delete the report. If you do this, the report is deleted permanently and cannot be recovered.

send.title: Send
send.text: The last icon lets you validate and send the report to the correct scheme.

checkbox.title: Checkbox
checkbox.text: The checkbox lets you select multiple reports to do grouped downloads or deletion.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: Welcome to the general settings page. Here you can configure the settings for your ForSURE account. This includes managing the access of the different users and setting country specific settings.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.text: Here you can configure your general settings such as the yearly growth rate of your company. We will warn you if reports exceed this threshold.

bug.title: Report Bugs
bug.text: If you encounter any issues, please report them here. We will investigate the issue and fix it as soon as possible.

userAccount.title: User Account
userAccount.text: Here you can configure your user account. You can see the orders you have made and the usage limits of your account.

users.title: Users
users.text: Here you can manage the access of the different users. You can add new users, edit their roles for the different parts of the software and remove them from your organization.

addUser.title: Add User
addUser.text: Adding a user is done by entering the email address of the user you want to add. They will receive an email with a link to create a password and log in to the software.

addAPI.title: API Integrations Overview
addAPI.text: Here you can manage the API integrations that you have configured. You can see the status of each integration, edit them and remove them.

addAPIToken.title: Add API Integration
addAPIToken.text: Adding an API integration is done by clicking this button. For third party integrations, configure the integration by entering the name, store URL and API key. For custom integrations, you can request an API token, which you can use to send us data. You can copy the token to your clipboard by clicking the copy button. Note that the token is only shown once, so make sure to save it in a secure location.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: This page is designed for uploading your existing category list and provides the tools needed to edit it, ensuring it conforms to the required format. It's a streamlined process for efficiently managing and updating your category data.

upload.title: Upload
upload.text: Simply click this button to add a category list. You can upload an existing categorylist by navigating to your file selection or you can add a categorylist from your Shopify store. \n\nOnce you've selected the categorylist, proceed to upload it here. This will create a popup where you can define the mappings, to make sure the uploaded categorylist is mapped to the labels our software can understand.

edit.title: Edit
edit.text:
Here you have the flexibility to modify your category list by adding new rows or columns to better organize your data. 

To edit the content of any cell, simply click on it. If only certain values are allowed, you can use the dropdown menu to select the correct value, otherwise you can just type in the value. 

If you want details about the column, you can hover over the column header to see a tooltip with the details. Clicking on the column header will allow you to edit the column name.

addRow.title: Add Row
addRow.text: Here you can add a new row to the category list. Each SKU is a new row and each row needs to have a unique SKU.

addColumn.title: Add Column
addColumn.text: Here you can add a new column to the category list. Columns are used to describe the properties of the products. For the countries that are supported by ForSURE, the columns can be mapped to predefined labels. For other countries, you should use Unmapped.

addRule.title: Add Rule
addRule.text: With this button you can add a new rule to the category list. Rules are used to add exceptions to the category list. For example, if you want to exclude a product from the reports, you can add a rule to exclude it.

save.title: Save
save.text: Here you can save the changes you made to the category list. Changes are not saved unless you click this button.

tabs.title: Tabs
tabs.text: Here you can filter the category list to only see the columns required by the different countries.

versions.title: Versions
versions.text: Here you can see the different versions of the category list to see the changes you made over time. Every time you save, you create a new version.

dropdown.title: Dropdown
dropdown.text: When you edit a cell, you can use the dropdown to select the correct value. Hovering over the options shows the description of the value. If the value is not in the dropdown, you can just type it in.

welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.text: This page shows you the usage of your account. You can see the usage of the orders and category list elements you have uploaded.
